intro: Physurus juruenensis, commonly known as the Juruenensis Physurus, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
